app.source.validazioneDataset package¶

Submodules¶

app.source.validazioneDataset.ValidazioneControl module¶

valida(userpath: str, simpleSplit: bool, kFold: bool, k: int)[source]¶

This function is going to validate a given Dataset with kFoldValidation or train_testSplit

Parameters

  • userpath – string that points to the location of the dataset that is going to be validated

  • simpleSplit – boolean flag that indicated whether the user wants to execute simpleSplit or not

  • kFold – boolean flag that indicated whether the user wants to execute kFoldValidation or not

  • k – number of groups that a given data sample will be split into

Returns

two validated dataset: ‘Data_training.csv’, ‘Data_testing.csv’

Return type

(str,str)

validazioneControl()[source]¶

app.source.validazioneDataset.kFoldValidation module¶

cross_fold_validation(userpath: str, k: int)[source]¶

This function is a data partitioning strategy so that you can effectively use your dataset to build a more generalized project.

Parameters

  • userpath – string that points to the location of the dataset that is going to be validated

  • k – number of groups that a given data sample will be split into

Returns

to be decided

app.source.validazioneDataset.train_testSplit module¶

splitDataset(filename: str)[source]¶

This function splits the dataset in training set and testing set in order to be consistent on the comparisons

Parameters

filename – string that points to the location of the dataset that will be split into

Returns

the dataset training set ‘Data_training.csv’ and the dataset testing set ‘Data_testing.csv’

Return type

(str,str)
